body.name: Smart Watch, Bluetooth Call Smartwatch for Men and Women,Monitoring Heart Rate/Sleep/Blood Oxygen/Pedometer,1.39-inch Fitness Tracker with Multiple Sports Modes,Smartwatches fit for IOS and Android
features: 🎨【COMPATIBLE WITH ANDROID AND iOS TO STAY CONNECTED ANYTIME, ANYWHERE】Android and iOS compatible smart watch connectivity lets you listen to and make calls, receive messages, store contact information, and view call logs. Our men's and women's smartwatches keep you up to date with emails, texts, social media and other apps, so you don't have to pull out your phone when you're busy, just check your wrist for the latest news.

🎨【FULL TOUCH COLOR SCREEN AND DIY DIAL】This smartwatch comes with a 1.39-inch full touch color screen with excellent picture quality for smoother use. This smartwatch for men and women supports multi-language, fitness tracking software can update the clock face, view more beautiful clock face in the app, watch wallpaper can be DIY, connect to your phone and design your own unique style.

🎨【PERSONALIZED HEALTH MONITORING】Our smartwatches with high performance sensors can monitor your heart rate, blood oxygen ,blood pressure, sleep quality , women's health, daily exercise, breathing exercisesin real time, which will provide you with personalized insights and help you adjust your lifestyle habits for optimal health.

🎨【MULTIPLE EXERCISE MODES】Our sports and fitness smartwatch comes with multiple built-in exercise modes including running, cycling and yoga, which allows you to track and analyze your physical activity specifically.

🎨【ADDITIONAL FEATURES AND WATERPROOF DESIGN】 Our smartwatches feature alarms, stopwatches, weather updates, sedentary reminders, and find my phone. The waterproof design also ensures that you can keep it working even when you wash your hands or when it rains.
🎨【QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE】 We prioritize your satisfaction. If you have any questions or problems with the product, please feel free to find us to solve the problem!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This watch looks amazing and was easy to setup. I love the round face.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: En lineas generales y en relacion precio vs calidad creo que es un reloj agradable, esteticamente muy bonito, gran cantidad de actividades para elegir y fondos tambien muy bonitos y se actualizan a menudo, en cuanto a la aplicacion creo que si le falta mostrar mas estadisticas en cuanto a los resultados despues de cargar una actividad. Lo menos bueno creo que seria la duracion de la bateria, si dejas encedido la opcion de que se active solo al levantar la mano la beteria dura una semana, apague esta opcion y me ha durado 2 semanas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The plastic on the face is horrid. Once it snaps you can no longer wear the watch and the plastic is super thin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really great smart watch, mobile app glitchy.
reviews.reviewText: I have been wearing this watch for about 2 months now. I like the functionality of the watch itself, but I notice that the mobile app isn't very consistent. I have used the watch to track my steps and my sleep which is great. However when syncing the watch to the GloryFit app, I have had issues with it. I have had to restart the app a couple times before it works properly. I had a different watch the used the DFit app which had its own issues. This watch's battery life is great, I have not had to charge as frequently as other watches. I can't speak on how waterproof the watch is, but I think it is a very nice watch. Comfortable to wear and easy to use. I have answered my phone with it a couple times which was great. I would recommend this watch for someone who wants one that doesn't need to be synced via Bluetooth all day long. The app can be iffy, but once synced it loads all your stats to your account.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not worth it
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't pair to the phone fully 😒 you can't answer a call through the watch or even call.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Snazzy TFT display with a variety of good watch faces and a decent range of stats
reviews.reviewText: Like many of the seemingly endless variations of budget priced Chinese made activity watches on offer the G25 (the model number, the watch itself has no brand name on it and the packaging is generic) is a mixed bag relative to premium brand watches from Garmin and Apple. The brand name watches just have more highly developed firmware, functionality and interfaces, even if they are less flashy, and a more coherent use of stats.All of these budget activity watches have certain features in common, including touch interface TFT screens, usually only a single LED emitter on the back for deriving pulse etc, a snappy and snazzy looking color display but poor readability in very bright light, and limited Bluetooth compatibility with anything other than the seller's phone app. I tend to think the real money is being made from the data collected by and from the app more than from selling the watches themselves.That said, and comparing this watch to other similar types of budget watches, this is a pretty good example of a budget priced activity and sports watch. On the plus side it has a much deeper library of watch faces and display options than some other budget watches that I have recently tried, and many that I have owned in the past. It can display the usual range of info like steps, distance, heart rate, etc. and derive stats about rest and stress and even blood pressure from what can be made of heart rate from the single LED. On the down side the watch was unable to pair with my phone, and so be a source of data to my favorite sports app, unless I was using the seller's app, the display had no time out adjustment and went to standby way too quickly, and the watch face displayed ongoing stats, like heart rate, in type so small it was almost illegible. There were other data only displays that showed heart rate and steps data more clearly, but the watch faces did a poor job of making the info readable at a glance.So, a pretty good watch relative to competing Chinese budget sports watches, although I suspect that all of the watches like this on offer are being churned out in one huge watch factory somewhere in China and then sold under a blizzard of various importer names via Amazon. ALl tha said, if you have to go for a budget solution to have a heart rate monitor sports watch this is a good looking and competent one at about fifty dollars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It works. I like it
reviews.reviewText: I had issues with SMS I had to completely to off my RCS Chat thing. But I now receive my SMS, it says there's a issues with Bluetooth connection. But It does receive my FB. messages and I can call and receive calls. So I guess it's fine. for $30 it's okay. Nd so far the battery doesn't last to long. Maybe 3 days if you don't have it on watch awake and don't turn it on all the time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent budget watch
reviews.reviewText: This watch arrived, and was destined to be my sons first smart watch of his own. He had previously used one of my older apple watches, and it was a total novelty. I actually think this watch is his preference, even though it's substantially cheaper.From the aesthetics, it's a decent looking watch, very large face, and decent quality image. The band felt a little cheap and plastic for my taste, but very appropriate for my son. You need to install an app to use the watch correctly, it's available on apple and android, and is super easy to get started with. My son spent hours on customizing it to his needs, and has become very attached to the watch.Battery life is OK, it certainly can last a full day on a single charge, but 2 days was pushing it, but this was with HEAVY usage. The screen must have been on at least 12 hours! With the fitness and health features, I've found my son has started wearing it every day, somewhat obsessed with monitoring his "stats".I'm not sure I'd recommend this for an adult, as it's a little basic, but for the price, it's a great option for someone looking for a budget watch, or a very solid option for the first watch for your child.
Very well made smartwatch, easy to set up and good value!

Edit:The battery charge the first time lasted 8 days. The second charge lasted 6 days. The third, fourth and fifth charge lasted 2 days. At this rate, in a month, the battery will last for a few hours. Also, there is no app on the watch to measure fitness routines such as weight training or yoga or other fitness classesOriginal review:The watchface I use has an analogue clock. The second hand flows smoothly across the seconds instead of halting on each second. The watchface also has day and date, weather, heart rate, and stepsThe watch can also give blood pressure as well as the usual heart rate and blood oxygen. DaFit is the app and I like it, although the watchfaces it offers are extremely childishThe measurements of the watch are not accurate but they're in the ballpark. e.g. The blood pressure may read 118/70 and the actual is 121/72. Ditto heart rate. I don't count steps but I have a measure that I can approximate and, again, the watch is in the ballparkBy default, the app shows outdoor running. If you use an exercise on the watch, the app records that as wellThe first time I charged the watch, it lasted about eight days. The watch notifies you when the battery is low. I charged it and forgot about it. I don't know how long it was charging. Again, lasted about eight days. The third charge lasted two days and it's charging right now. It will be interesting to see how long the battery lastsThe negative is the band. Inside, it's red and it's uncomfortable to wear
This watch is beautiful, easy to use, feels groningen the wrist, and is a steal for the price.
The media could not be loaded. Was really surprised by the watch you get for the money! Meets all expectations plus some.
